intro: Koanophyllon simillimum, commonly known as the desert flax, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of North America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and ragworts, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to survive in harsh, dry environments. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in fine hairs to reduce water loss. Koanophyllon simillimum produces small, yellowish flowers that bloom in the spring, attracting various pollinators.
